page.title: 03The Village Church
page.content: St.Laurences church is situated at the top of Bear hill in Alvechurch. It has recently acquired a new rector. His name is Mr Alan Hayward. Part of this Saxon church was destroyed in the Civil War in the seventeenth century. The only historical parts that are left are the North Aisle and the tower.The South Aisle, Nave and Altar were restored in later years.The church contains 35 stained glass windows, two of which have recently been replaced. There are 46 pews, and of the 65 organ pipes visible some are not in use. There are 8 bells in the tower. It has three clocks. There is a list of all the rectors. The first of whom was Robert De Wyche. Others were John Wattes, William Hollington and John Frederick Tonyn.
